## About Me

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-6 #about-me-1}

Zeju Li's research focuses on machine learning and its applications in medical image processing, with an emphasis on neuroimaging analysis and addressing clinical problems. 

He has published over 30 peer-reviewed publications, many of which have been published in top-tier journals and conferences including TMI and MICCAI. 

His work has garnered over 4,000 citations on [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.co.uk/citations?user=zeuflXEAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao). He has won championships in the Huawei AI Challenge and the MICCAI Challenge, and serves as an area chair for conferences such as MICCAI and MIDL.

:::

::: {.g-col-6 #about-me-2}

Zeju was a Post-Doctoral Researcher in the [FMRIB Analysis Group](https://www.win.ox.ac.uk/research/analysis-research) at the University of Oxford before joining Fudan in February 2025. 

He obtained his PhD in Computing from the [BioMedIA Group](https://biomedia.doc.ic.ac.uk/). He spent time at the Institute of Computing Technology and Huawei Noah's Ark Lab (London).
